046/**
047 * This class defines static utility methods adding to ImageJs functionality.
048 * @author WB
049 *
050 */
051public abstract class IjUtils {
052        
053        private IjUtils() {}
054        
055        /**
056         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
057         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
058         * 
059         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
060         * @return an array of currently open images.
061         */
062        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
063                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
064        }
065        
066
067        /**
068         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
069         * of the images supplied.
070         * 
071         * @param images array of images.
072         * @return array of names.
073         */
074        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
075                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
076                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
077                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
078                }
079                return imageNames;
080        }
081        
082        /**
083         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
084         * @param title string to show in the dialog
085         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
086         */
087        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
088                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
089                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
090                if (title == null) {
091                        title = "image:";
092                }
093                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
094                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
095                gd.showDialog(); 
096                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
097                        return null;
098                else {
099                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
100                }
101        }
102        
103        
104        /**
105         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
106         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
107         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
108         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
109         * 
110         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
111         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
112         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
113         */
114        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
115                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
116                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
117        if (wList != null) {
118                for (int i : wList) {
119                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
120                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
121                        imgList.add(imp);
122                    }
123                }
124        }
125        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
126        if (sortByTitle) {
127                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
128                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
129                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
130                        }
131                };
132                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
133        }
134                return impArr;
135        }
136        
137
138        /**
139         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
140         *  
141         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
142         * @return path of the selected resource.
143         */
144        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
145                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
146                String dir = od.getDirectory();
147                String name = od.getFileName();
148                if (name == null)
149                        return null;
150                return encodeURL(dir + name);
151        }
152        
153        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
154                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
155                url = url.replace('\\','/');
156                return url;
157        }
158        
159        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
160        
161
162        /**
163         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
164         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
165         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
166         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
167         * 
168         * @param title image title
169         * @param M 2D array
170         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
171         */
172        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
173                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
174                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
175                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
176                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
177                        }
178                }
179                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
180        }
181        
182
183        /**
184         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
185         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
186         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
187         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
188         * 
189         * @param title the image title
190         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
191         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
192         */
193        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
194                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
195                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
196                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
197                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
198                        }
199                }
200                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
201        }
202        
203        /**
204         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
205         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
206         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
207         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
208         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
209         * 
210         * @param ip The affected image
211         */
212        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
213                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
214        }
215        
216        /**
217         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
218         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
219         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
220         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
221         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
222         * 
223         * @param ip The affected image
224         * @param wr Red weight
225         * @param wg Green weight
226         * @param wb Blue weight
227         */
228        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
229                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
230                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
231                }
232        }
233        
234        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
235        
236        /**
237         * Extracts (crops) a rectangular region from the given image
238         * and returns it as a new image (of the same sub-type of {@link ImageProcessor}).
239         * If the specified rectangle extends outside the source image,
240         * only the overlapping region is cropped.
241         * Thus the returned image may have smaller size than the specified rectangle.
242         * An exception is thrown if the specified width or height is less than 1.
243         * {@code null} is returned if the rectangle does not overlap the image at all.
244         * 
245         * @param <T> the generic image type
246         * @param ip the image to be cropped
247         * @param x the left corner coordinate of the cropping rectangle
248         * @param y the top corner coordinate of the cropping rectangle
249         * @param width the width of the cropping rectangle
250         * @param height the height of the cropping rectangle
251         * @return the cropped image
252         */
253        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
254        public static <T extends ImageProcessor> T crop(T ip, int x, int y, int width, int height) {
255//              if (x < 0 || x >= ip.getWidth() || y < 0 || y >= ip.getHeight()) {
256//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("(x,y) must be inside the image");
257//              }
258                if (width < 1 || height < 1) {
259                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("width/height must be at least 1");
260                }
261//              if (x + width > ip.getWidth() || y + height > ip.getHeight()) {
262//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("crop rectangle must be inside the image");
263//              }
264                T ipc = null;
265                synchronized (ip) {
266                        Rectangle roiOrig = ip.getRoi();
267                        ip.setRoi(x, y, width, height);
268                        Rectangle roiTmp = ip.getRoi();
269                        if (roiTmp.width > 0 && roiTmp.height > 0) {
270                                ipc = (T) ip.crop();
271                        }
272                        ip.setRoi(roiOrig);
273                }
274                return ipc;
275        }
276        
277        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
278        
279        /** 
280         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
281         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
282         * @param fp the image
283         * @return the resulting array
284         */
285        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
286                final int width = fp.getWidth();
287                final int height = fp.getHeight();
288                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
289                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
290                int i = 0;
291                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
292                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
293                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
294                                i++;
295                        }
296                }
297                return dPixels;
298        }
299        
300        /**
301         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
302         * from the given {@code double[][]} with dimensions 
303         * [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
304         * 
305         * @param A a 2D {@code double} array
306         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
307         */
308        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] A) {
309                final int width = A.length;
310                final int height = A[0].length;
311                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
312                int i = 0;
313                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
314                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
315                                fPixels[i] = (float) A[u][v];
316                                i++;
317                        }
318                }
319                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
320        }
321        
322        /**
323         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
324         * from the given {@code float[][]} with dimensions 
325         * [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
326         * 
327         * @param A a 2D {@code float} array
328         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
329         */
330        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(float[][] A) {
331//              final int width = A.length;
332//              final int height = A[0].length;
333//              float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
334//              int i = 0;
335//              for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
336//                      for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
337//                              fPixels[i] = A[u][v];
338//                              i++;
339//                      }
340//              }
341//              return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
342                return new FloatProcessor(A);
343        }
344        
345        /**
346         * Converts a {@link FloatProcessor} to a {@code float[][]}.
347         * @param fp a {@link FloatProcessor}
348         * @return the resulting {@code float[][]}
349         */
350        public static float[][] toFloatArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
351//              final int w = fp.getWidth();
352//              final int h = fp.getHeight();
353//              float[][] A = new float[w][h];
354//              for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
355//                      for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
356//                              A[u][v] =  fp.getf(u, v);
357//                      }
358//              }
359//              return A;
360                return fp.getFloatArray();
361        }
362        
363        /**
364         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
365         * {@link ByteProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights.
366         * The processor's individual RGB component weights are used if they have
367         * been set (not null), otherwise ITU709 weights (see {@link RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights}) 
368         * are applied.
369         * This is to avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
370         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
371         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
372         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
373         * 
374         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
375         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
376         * @see #toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
377         */
378        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
379                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
380                        return toByteProcessor(cp, null);
381                }
382                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
383                        return cp.convertToByteProcessor();
384                }
385        }
386        
387        /**
388         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
389         * {@link ByteProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
390         * The processor's individual weights (if set) are ignored.
391         * This is to avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
392         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
393         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
394         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
395         * 
396         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
397         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
398         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
399         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
400         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
401         */
402        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
403                if (rgbWeights == null) {
404                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
405                }
406                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
407                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
408                }
409                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
410                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
411                ByteProcessor bp = cp.convertToByteProcessor();
412                ((ColorProcessor) cp).setRGBWeights(oldweights);
413                return bp;
414        }
415        
416        /**
417         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
418         * {@link FloatProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights.
419         * The processor's individual RGB component weights are used if 
420         * set, otherweise default weights are used (see {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}).
421         * This should avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
422         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
423         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
424         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
425         * 
426         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
427         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
428         * @see #toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
429         */
430        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
431                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
432                        return toFloatProcessor(cp, null);
433                }
434                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
435                        return cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
436                }
437        }
438        
439        /**
440         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
441         * {@link FloatProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
442         * If {@code null} is passed for the weights, default weights are used
443         * (see {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}).
444         * The processor's individual weights (if set at all) are ignored.
445         * This should avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
446         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
447         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
448         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
449         * 
450         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
451         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
452         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
453         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
454         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
455         */
456        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
457                if (rgbWeights == null) {
458                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
459                }
460                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
461                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
462                }
463                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
464                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
465                FloatProcessor fp = cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
466                ((ColorProcessor) cp).setRGBWeights(oldweights);
467                return fp;
468        }
469        
470        /**
471         * Creates and returns a new {@link ByteProcessor} from
472         * the specified 2D {@code byte} array, assumed to be
473         * arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
474         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
475         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
476         * the height of the resulting image.
477         * 
478         * @param A a 2D {@code byte} array
479         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x {@code A[0].length}
480         */
481        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(byte[][] A) {
482                final int w = A.length;
483                final int h = A[0].length;
484                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
485                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
486                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
487                                bp.putPixel(u, v, 0xFF & A[u][v]);
488                        }
489                }
490                return bp;
491        }
492        
493        /**
494         * Creates and returns a new {@code byte[][]} from
495         * the specified {@link ByteProcessor}.
496         * The resulting array is arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]},
497         * i.e., the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
498         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
499         * the height of the image.
500         * 
501         * @param bp a {@link ByteProcessor}
502         * @return a 2D {@code byte} array
503         */
504        public static byte[][] toByteArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
505                final int w = bp.getWidth();
506                final int h = bp.getHeight();
507                byte[][] A = new byte[w][h];
508                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
509                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
510                                A[u][v] =  (byte) (0xFF & bp.get(u, v));
511                        }
512                }
513                return A;
514        }
515        
516        /**
517         * Creates and returns a new {@link ByteProcessor} from
518         * the specified 2D {@code int} array, assumed to be
519         * arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
520         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
521         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
522         * the height of the resulting image.
523         * Pixel values are clamped to [0, 255].
524         * 
525         * @param A a 2D {@code int} array
526         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x {@code A[0].length}
527         */
528        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(int[][] A) {
529                final int w = A.length;
530                final int h = A[0].length;
531                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
532                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
533                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
534                                int val = A[u][v];
535                                if (val < 0)
536                                        val = 0;
537                                else if (val > 255) 
538                                        val = 255;
539                                bp.putPixel(u, v, val);
540                        }
541                }
542                return bp;
543        }
544        
545        /**
546         * Creates and returns a new {@code int[][]} from
547         * the specified {@link ByteProcessor}.
548         * The resulting array is arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]},
549         * i.e., the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
550         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
551         * the height of the image.
552         * 
553         * @param bp a {@link ByteProcessor}
554         * @return a 2D {@code int} array
555         */
556        public static int[][] toIntArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
557                return bp.getIntArray();
558        }
559        
560        /**
561         * Opens the image from the specified {@link URI} and returns it
562         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
563         * 
564         * @param uri the URI leading to the image (including extension)
565         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if unable to open
566         */
567        public static ImagePlus openImage(URI uri) {
568                Objects.requireNonNull(uri);
569                return new Opener().openImage(uri.toString());
570        }
571        
572        /**
573         * Opens the image from the specified filename and returns it
574         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
575         * 
576         * @param filename the path and filename to be opened
577         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if unable to open
578         */
579        public static ImagePlus openImage(String filename) {
580                return openImage(new File(filename).toURI());
581        }
582        
583        
584        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
585        
586        /**
587         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
588         * 
589         * @param ip1 the first image
590         * @param ip2 the second image
591         * @return true if both images have the same type
592         */
593        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
594                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
595        }
596        
597        /**
598         * Checks if two images have the same size.
599         * 
600         * @param ip1 the first image
601         * @param ip2 the second image
602         * @return true if both images have the same size
603         */
604        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
605                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
606        }
607        
608        /**
609         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that
610         * the image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which
611         * must be zero. All pixels are checked.
612         * This should work for all image types.
613         * More efficient implementations are certainly possible.
614         * 
615         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
616         * @return true if the image is binary
617         */
618        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
619                final int width = ip.getWidth();
620                final int height = ip.getHeight();
621                int fgVal = 0;
622                boolean binary = true;
623                
624                outer:
625                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
626                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
627                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
628                                if (val != 0) {
629                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
630                                                fgVal = val;
631                                        }
632                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
633                                                binary = false;
634                                                break outer;
635                                        }
636                                }
637                        }
638                }
639                
640                return binary;
641        }
642        
643        /**
644         * Checks if the given image is "flat", i.e., all pixels have
645         * the same value.
646         * This should work for all image types.
647         * 
648         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
649         * @return true if the image is flat
650         */
651        public static boolean isFlat(ImageProcessor ip) {
652                final int width = ip.getWidth();
653                final int height = ip.getHeight();
654                boolean flat = true;
655                int fgVal = ip.get(0, 0);
656                
657                outer:
658                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
659                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
660                                int val = ip.get(u, v);
661                                if (val != fgVal) {
662                                        flat = false;
663                                        break outer;
664                                }
665                        }
666                }
667                
668                return flat;
669        }
670        
671        /**
672         * Collects all image coordinates with non-zero pixel values into an array
673         * of 2D points ({@link Pnt2d}).
674         * 
675         * @param ip an image (of any type)
676         * @return an array of 2D points
677         */
678        public static Pnt2d[] collectNonzeroPoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
679                List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
680                int M = ip.getWidth();
681                int N = ip.getHeight();
682                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
683                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
684                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
685                                if (val != 0) {
686                                        points.add(PntInt.from(u, v));
687                                }
688                        }
689                }
690                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
691        }
692        
693        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
694        
695        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
696        
697        /**
698         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
699         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance}).
700         * 
701         * @param ip1 the first image
702         * @param ip2 the second image
703         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
704         */
705        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
706                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
707        }
708        
709        /**
710         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
711         * the specified tolerance). 
712         * 
713         * @param ip1 the first image
714         * @param ip2 the second image
715         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
716         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
717         */
718        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
719                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
720                        return false;
721                }
722                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
723                        return false;
724                }
725                
726                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
727                        byte[] p1 = (byte[]) ip1.getPixels();
728                        byte[] p2 = (byte[]) ip2.getPixels();
729                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
730                }
731                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
732                        short[] p1 = (short[]) ip1.getPixels();
733                        short[] p2 = (short[]) ip2.getPixels();
734                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
735                }
736                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
737                        int[] p1 = (int[]) ip1.getPixels();
738                        int[] p2 = (int[]) ip2.getPixels();
739                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
740                }
741                
742                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
743                        float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
744                        float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
745                        boolean same = true;
746                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
747                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
748                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
749                                        same = false;
750                                        break;
751                                }
752                        }
753                        return same;
754                }
755
756                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
757        }
758        
759        // BitMap from/to ByteProcessor conversion
760        /**
761         * Converts the specified {@link ByteProcessor} to a {@link BitMap}
762         * of the same size,
763         * with all zero values set to 0 and non-zero values set to 1.
764         * @param bp a {@link ByteProcessor}
765         * @return the corresponding {@link BitMap}
766         * @see #convertToByteProcessor(BitMap)
767         */
768        public static BitMap convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor bp) {
769                return new BitMap(bp.getWidth(), bp.getHeight(), (byte[]) bp.getPixels());
770        }
771
772        /**
773         * <p>
774         * Converts the specified {@link BitMap} to a {@link ByteProcessor}
775         * of the same size,
776         * with all zero values set to 0 and non-zero values set to 1.
777         * The resulting image should be multiplied by 255 to achieve full
778         * contrast, e.g.:
779         * </p>
780         * <pre>
781         * ByteProcessor bp1 = ... // some ByteProcessor
782         * BitMap bm = IjUtils.convertToBitMap(bp);
783         * ByteProcessor bp2 = IjUtils.convertToByteProcessor(bm);
784         * bp2.multiply(255);
785         * ... </pre>
786         * 
787         * @param bitmap a {@link BitMap}
788         * @return the corresponding {@link ByteProcessor}
789         * @see #convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor)
790         */
791        public static ByteProcessor convertToByteProcessor(BitMap bitmap) {
792                byte[] pixels = bitmap.getBitVector().toByteArray();
793                return new ByteProcessor(bitmap.getWidth(), bitmap.getHeight(), pixels);
794        }
795        
796        /**
797         * Draws the given set of points onto the specified image
798         * (by setting the corresponding pixels).
799         * 
800         * @param ip the image to draw to
801         * @param points the 2D points
802         * @param value the pixel value to use
803         */
804        public static void drawPoints(ImageProcessor ip, Pnt2d[] points, int value) {
805                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
806                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
807                        if (p != null) {
808                                int u = p.getXint();
809                                int v = p.getYint();
810                                ip.putPixel(u, v, value);
811                        }
812                }
813        }
814        
815        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
816        
817        /**
818         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance with empty argument string.
819         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
820         * @return true if no exception was thrown
821         */
822        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter) {
823                return run(pluginfilter, "");
824        }
825        
826        /**
827         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance.
828         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
829         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}
830         * @return true if no exception was thrown
831         */
832        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter, String arg) {
833                try {
834                        new PlugInFilterRunner(pluginfilter, pluginfilter.getClass().getSimpleName(), arg);
835                } catch (Exception e) {
836                        return false;
837                }
838                return true;
839        }
840        
841        /**
842         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance with empty argument string.
843         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
844         * @return true if no exception was thrown
845         */
846        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin) {
847                return run(plugin, "");
848        }
849        
850        /**
851         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance.
852         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
853         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugIn#run(String)}
854         * @return true if no exception was thrown
855         */
856        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin, String arg) {
857                try {
858                        plugin.run(arg);
859                } catch (Exception e) {
860                        return false;
861                }
862                return true;
863        }
864        
865        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
866        
867        /**
868         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class with empty argument string.
869         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter)} instead.
870         * @param clazz class of the pluginfilter
871         * @return true if no exception was thrown
872         */
873        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz) {
874                return runPlugInFilter(clazz, "");
875        }
876        
877        /**
878         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class.
879         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter, String)} instead.
880         * @param clazz class of the plugin
881         * @param arg argument string
882         * @return true if no exception was thrown
883         */
884        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz, String arg) {
885                PlugInFilter thePlugIn = null;
886                try {
887                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
888                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
889                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
890                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
891                }
892                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
893        }
894        
895        /**
896         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class with empty argument string.
897         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn)} instead.
898         * @param clazz class of the plugin
899         * @return true if no exception was thrown
900         */
901        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz) {
902                return runPlugIn(clazz, "");
903        }
904        
905        /**
906         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class.
907         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn, String)} instead.
908         * @param clazz class of the plugin
909         * @param arg argument string
910         * @return true if no exception was thrown
911         */
912        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz, String arg) {
913                PlugIn thePlugIn = null;
914                try {
915                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
916                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
917                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
918                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
919                }
920                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
921        }
922
923        
924        //  static methods for filtering images using ImageJ's {@link Convolver} class. 
925
926        /**
927         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
928         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in horizontal direction only.#
929         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
930         * 
931         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
932         * @param h the filter kernel
933         * @see Convolver
934         */
935        public static void convolveX (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) { // TODO: unit test missing
936                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
937                conv.setNormalize(false);
938                conv.convolve(ip, h, h.length, 1);
939        }
940
941        /**
942         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
943         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in vertical direction only.
944         * The supplied filter kernel must be odd-sized. It is not normalized.
945         * 
946         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
947         * @param h the filter kernel
948         * @see Convolver
949         */
950        public static void convolveY (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) {
951                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
952                conv.setNormalize(false);
953                conv.convolve(ip, h, 1, h.length);
954        }
955
956        /**
957         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
958         * which is modified.
959         * The same 1D kernel is applied twice, once in horizontal and once in
960         * vertical direction.
961         * The supplied filter kernel must be odd-sized. It is not normalized.
962         * 
963         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
964         * @param h the filter kernel
965         * @see Convolver
966         */
967        public static void convolveXY (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) {
968                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
969                conv.setNormalize(false);
970                conv.convolve(ip, h, h.length, 1);
971                conv.convolve(ip, h, 1, h.length);
972        }
973        
974        /**
975         * Applies a two-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
976         * which is modified. The supplied kernel {@code float[x][y]} must be 
977         * rectangular and odd-sized. It is not normalized.
978         * 
979         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
980         * @param H the filter kernel
981         */
982        public static void convolve(ImageProcessor ip, float[][] H) {
983                float[] h = Matrix.flatten(H);  // TODO: right order? transpose?
984                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
985                conv.setNormalize(false);
986                conv.convolve(ip, h, H[0].length, H.length);
987        }
988        
989        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
990        
991        /**
992         * Saves the given {@link ImageProcessor} using the specified
993         * path. The image file type is inferred from the file extension.
994         * TIFF is used if no file extension is given.
995         * This method simply invokes {@link IJ#save(ImagePlus, String)},
996         * creating a temporary and titleless {@link ImagePlus} instance.
997         * Existing files with the same path are overwritten.
998         * 
999         * @param ip a {@link ImageProcessor}
1000         * @param filepath the path where to save the image, e.g. {@code "C:/tmp/MyImage.png"}
1001         * @return the absolute file path
1002         */
1003        public static String save(ImageProcessor ip, String filepath) {
1004                // TODO: check if the file was actually written or not
1005                File file = Paths.get(filepath).toFile();
1006                String absPath = file.getAbsolutePath();
1007                IJ.save(new ImagePlus("", ip), absPath);
1008                return absPath;
1009        }
